intro: Guaduella humilis, commonly known as the low guaduella, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
